title: 107_s2187
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002" authorizes the Department to provide health care during major disasters and medical emergencies. The Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002 allows the Secretary to provide hospital care and medical services during major disasters and medical emergencies declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated. The Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002 allows the Secretary to provide care and services to veterans without enrollment restrictions during disasters. Priority is given to veterans with service-connected disabilities and active-duty members of the Armed Forces. Reimbursement for care provided to non-Department officers or employees is required. The Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002 allows the Secretary to provide care and services to veterans during disasters. Reimbursement for care provided to non-Department officers or employees is required, with amounts received credited to the Department facility. The Secretary must report to Congress on facility and personnel allocation within 60 days of a disaster. Regulations governing the Secretary's authority under this section will be prescribed. The Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002 grants the Secretary authority to provide care during disasters. Reimbursement for care to non-Department personnel is required, with funds credited to Department facilities. New sections are added to the table of contents for reporting purposes. The Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002 authorizes the Secretary to provide care during disasters and emergencies. Reimbursement for care to non-Department personnel is required, with funds credited to Department facilities. Amendments allow for the provision of hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services to members of the Armed Forces during war, national emergencies, disasters, or emergencies. The Secretary may provide hospital care and medical services to active duty members of the Armed Forces during disasters or emergencies declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated. Priority may be given to this care over other eligible groups, except for veterans with service-connected disabilities.
